contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=March 2013}} ''''Fighting' Bob Martin''' (November 11, 1897 â€“ 1978) was a heavyweight [[boxing]] champion who became the Heavyweight Champion of the American Expeditionary Forces and Inter-Allied Armies during [[World War I]]. He fought against future heavyweight champion, [[Gene Tunney]], in 1918, but lost in 4 rounds. ==External links== * http://www.tunney.org/bobmartin.html {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Martin, Bob | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American boxer | DATE OF BIRTH = November 11, 1897 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1978 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Martin, Bob}} [[Category:1897 births]] [[Category:1978 deaths]] [[Category:American boxers]] [[Category:Heavyweight boxers]] [[Category:Place of birth missing]] [[Category:American military personnel of World War I]] {{US-boxing-bio-stub}}
